headline: Perfect Summer Fruit Salad
description: This fantastic fruit salad combines pineapple, kiwi, bananas, oranges, grapes, and berries in a sweet citrusy sauce for a colorful dessert.

video.description: A rainbow of color and flavor, this truly is the Perfect Summer Fruit Salad!
video.name: Perfect Summer Fruit Salad

name: Perfect Summer Fruit Salad

recipeInstructions.text: For the sauce: Bring orange juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, orange zest, and lemon zest to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Set aside to cool.

For the salad: Layer fruit in a large, clear glass bowl in this order: pineapple, strawberries, kiwi fruit, bananas, oranges, grapes, and blueberries. Pour cooled sauce over fruit; cover and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: Liked this fruit salad very much. The sauce blended all the fruit nicely yet you still tasted each fruit. I started layering the fruits but when I added the sauce I mixed it all up. Not sure why you need to wait 2-3 hours before serving. The bananas did get a little mushy after a couple hours out on the counter. Still had great flavor. The sauce never did thicken though I cooked it for 10+ minutes, but still tasted good. I liked the way all the fruits tasted like they belonged.

We prepared this fruit salad for a small party that we held this week. It was a huge hit and better than even we thought that it would be. Definitely worth the 5*. I tried to stick very much to the recipe for this time, with the only exception being that I added 5 kiwi fruits since that was what the container I purchased held and I didn't want to waste the other 2. I actually thought that the 5 fruits was a perfect quantity and, after looking at it, that 3 might be a little light, to be honest. I wouldn't change a thing, to be honest, and plan on making this again when future activities call for it. The only negative was that the blueberries that I purchased were a little more sour than I would have liked but that is no fault of the salad. Overall, two thumbs up from ourselves and everyone that we served it to.
It was great. I may change it up next time but for now, perfect.
My family loved it. Didn’t change a thing.
Excellent. Dressing was very good.
I did not make any changes. Made it exactly as the recipe called for. It was easy to make and everyone loved the taste. I will make it again
I love this recipe! The sauce is amazing. I have been making it for the 4th of July and it has become a repeat request dish for me to bring! Thank you!!
Fabulous salad. Good for you too
I made this fruit salad for a graduation party last summer. It was simple and flavourful!
I’ve made this twice now - pot luck and family gathering. Compliments and recipe requests galore. Leftovers are delicious.
Salad was delish and very bright and colorful! I used tangerine instead of orange segments and it was perfect.
Such a delicious recipe!

I took this dish to a party of fourteen . Everyone loved it and asked for the recipe! It made my day. The hostess is a real italian foodie. This is the first fruit salad I have made with a sauce. I will surely make it again. Some of the guests were kidding about adding some vodka and lemoncello instead of the lemon juice.
Its not only pretty but delicious!!!
yummy!!!

I made this for a baptism luncheon and it was all gone. This is a beautiful presentation and delicious fruit salad! I was worried about making the dish the night before as I was concerned the fruit would brown or get mushy. Instead, I made the sauce the night before(delicious) and let simmer longer than the prescribed time to thicken up and refrigerated. While simmering, I cut up all of the fruit (except for the bananas) and put in individual baggies. Instead of oranges, I used cuties. It thought they looked pretty and we love those little oranges. In the morning, I cut up the bananas and layered everything just as shown in a truffle bowl, drizzled the sauce on top, and covered with saran wrap. Perfect! I will definitely make this again. Thank you for the recipe!
I made this for Vacation bible school and everyone loved it
I changed the fruit a bit but it was still delicious.

I used the juice from the Pineapple, (Non-Heavy Syrup) 4 Tbsp. Local Honey, 2 Tbsp. Lime. Mixed without cooking. Mixed it in with the fruit and refrigerated it. Taking it out from time to time to fold the juices from the bottom and further mix the flavors together.

I made this for a cookout yesterday. Guests were so complimentary of this salad. As others have said, you can prepare some of the fruit the day before. I left out bananas and added cherries. I will try the bananas in it next time. Note: If you have leftovers, there seems to be more liquid in this dish the second day.
Perfect! I took it to a 4th of July BBQ and people raved about it! I left out bananas and added fresh mandarin oranges, several fresh peaches, and blackberries. Delicious!

Ruined perfectly decent fruit. I made this recipe 5 hours before serving. I brought it to a potluck and was embarrassed by it once I took the lid off. I should have checked it before I left the house. I didn’t even add all of the sauce but it turned all the fruit brown and mushy with a pool of dressing at the bottom and it didn’t even taste good to boot. Don’t bring this anywhere without a trial run first.

Another holiday and another occasion for this salad. Everyone loves this, as it is lightly sweet without giving you ‘sugar shock’. It lets the fruit shine through and doesn’t make you feel like you just ate dessert (although it is certainly good enough to be considered a treat!).

Yummy Yummy fruit salad! I made this fruit salad recipe for a family get together- and it worked great! Silly me forgot to add vanilla into the sauce but it still tasted great! Since I was in a bit of a rush, I just mixed orange juice with a bit of lemon juice. Delicious!
I made this as directed for our Fathers Day picnic, everyone loved it!!
I increased the sauce by half. Other than that it was perfect. I even got compliments from the toughest in the picnic crowd.
This was super easy to make and everyone loved it. It was really light and tasted wonderful. I’ll definitely be making this whenever there’s a family gathering.
Forgiving recipe that makes any meal great! I make this for breakfast, lunch, or dinner! Delicious!
The syrup did not thicken, so it was watery on the bottom but the fruit was yummy

After all the reviews I thought this was going to be awesome, but it was far from it. I would of enjoyed the fruit as is, without this sauce that soaked the fruit up way too much. Got mushy pretty quickly and I didn’t even add the bananas. I ended up dumping half the juice out too, but it still was too soggy. What a waste of all the fruit.
Looked so pretty!
This was amazing! We used canned pineapple, and ended up adding a little bit of the pineapple juice to the sauce. We didn't have kiwis, so we just went without them, but turned out so delicious!

Thank you for this recipe, it was amazing! Friends and family loved it. Tasted like a customized Dole Fruit cup, lol. I changed some of the fruit and can't wait to make a few variations of this recipe.
I love this recipe.
Doubled the recipe for a large group - no leftovers! Lots of raves! Will definitely make this again.
Personally I don’t like vanilla and brown sugar in fruit I’m doing a 40 day sugar fact and was disappointed that it had sugar in it. But I made it with out it and it was basic but not bad.

What a Great Summer fruit salad. I added blue and blackberries and half the brown sugar to be more Weight Watchers friendly. That made the sauce a little thinner but who knew amidst all the great fruit flavor.

This is delicious!!! I wasn't sure if I was going to like the syrup, but was pleasantly surprised. I'm going to make again for a family BBQ this weekend. 
I just used the fruit I had on hand and it was very good. Pineapple, mango, clementines, grapes, blueberries, apple and banana. 
I think the kiwi and strawberry would go beautifully with this sauce and fresh summer peaches. I can't wait to make this again!
This recipe was a hit at a family gathering.
Love this one! Very refreshing in the summer heat!
It was delicious and so easy. Great when you have a crowd to serve.
Kiwi and pineapple are refreshing additions. I will halve or possibly eliminate the sugar next time
This turned out really good. I used canned pineapple chunks, canned mandarin oranges and added fresh blackberries to the recipe.
I made this and it was wonderful. My question is why did it say to use a glass bowl? I didn't.
This is fabulous! It tastes like summer in a bowl. I NEVER have leftovers and always get requests for this dish!! Perfect as is.

I agree this is a great sauce for fruit salad. Got rave reviews. It is also quite flexible- you can make it with any fruits you wish, and don’t have to layer it if you don’t want to. The other day, I made it with peaches, blueberries, and strawberries as that was all I had, put in a little chopped mint and mixed it up! Delish. I did not change anything about the “sauce” though.
I saw this recipe and thought that it would be good. But to my delight, it was great! It truly is the Perfect summer fruit salad. Thank you for sharing! Now, off I go to finish eating it! YuMM!

Amazing! I didn't have OJ but I has Naked Mango juice it was still good. 
got the fruit already cut from Cosco to save time.
didnt change a thing and it was delish
This was an awesome salad. Way too much for our family of three but we made it into smoothies the next day and it was delicious for that! Just added milk and yogurt!
This is the best fruit salad you will ever try. I made everything up the day before and put it in my refrigerator overnight. The next day I served it at our cook out! Delicious!
The perfect go-to summer salad.
This recipe is simple, and tastes great. However, I would skip the vanilla altogether. It doesn't work well with these fruits in my opinion. The juice/sugar reduction is good enough without it.
complete hit! The dressing was amazing - nice and light. The citrus was a great addition.

Just about any combo of fruits would taste heavenly dressed with this syrup. I used strawberries, black grapes, blueberries and pineapple. Prepared about 1 hour before serving and it was perfect. Delicious way to get your vitamins and fiber
Made it just as the recipe called for and it was great
Have made this several times. It is always a hit. Even better the next day!
Thanks! I loved it! I made it with apples, grapes and bananas! It was delicious!

I made the recipe exactly as written. I gave it a 5 star because it deserves one. I made a couple mistakes so it wasn’t a 5 star but only a 4 because of my mistakes. First I made it the night before. I layered all the fruit and I should not have put in the bananas because they weren’t as fresh as they should have been. Second, I forgot the vanilla so I decided to just put the vanilla in and stir it up in hopes it mixed with the sauce. So I had to stir it the night before which didn’t help my bananas or kiwi which started to fall apart. Third, my fruit was not ripe enough or in season so we all know there taste was not up to par. I will definitely make this again and again! I will remember my mistakes and correct those. If I have to cut up the fruit again the night before, I will put each fruit in a plastic bag and not cut my bananas. I will also make my slices a little thicker. I might also use tangerines instead of oranges. My oranges came from California but I didn’t like how thick the rinds where and the taste was off. I think my salad will be perfect next time. Thank you for such a clean food salad!
Always a hit!
I made this for a party and it was a hit. My bowl came back empty.

I left out the kiwis and used fewer blueberries because I use organic whenever possible and they were a bit expensive. The sauce was great - just the right amount of sweet and tangy from the zest. My family loved it for dessert.

It was a big hit with my fellow Associates. The only thing is the amount is small so I will double up on everything the next time. I also let it sit in the sauce over night flipping the bowl a couple of times to ensure all fruits were coded. Thank you for sharing!
Yes, it IS perfect!
Added raspberry.watermelon.blackberries.
Very time consuming but worth the effort. Fresh and extremely pleasant. Nice combination of fruits with a lil zest.

My first reaction was... why do I need a recipe to cut up fruit in a bowl? Then I saw the “dressing” and gave it a try. It’s not bad. Sometimes you try to pick out the sweet fruit and there is a stinker in the bunch that just is not sweet. The dressing would help that. I was fortunate to get a great batch of fruit and berries. The dressing seemed to take away from the individual flavors. Each piece tasted the same. Good for off season but a good summer bowl of fruit is yummy without the added sugar and vanilla. IMHO
Used a little less sugar. Fruit made up for the sweetness with the tartness of the citrus

Did not care for this at all. The fruit was better before the sauce. It had a tart taste that seemed to sour the fruit. It never gets thick nothing in the ingredients to thicken it. Would not make again.
Just as delicious as everyone says it is!

I made this for a family celebration and was a bit nervous about using the "sauce" thinking it would be way too sweet. I used it anyway and, instead of layering the fruit, mixed it all up. It was a HUGE hit and (much to my dismay) there was nothing left from the double recipe I made. This will definitely play a role in future get togethers.

Quadrupled the recipe to feed a large group. Yes, 4 times the amounts listed. Cannot believe the responses from guests. All but a small amount in the bottom of the bowl was left. I have since made it again just for the family. I actually doubled the amount of dressing. Worked out perfectly because we spooned the fruit mixture over dessert cakes and added whipped cream. Yum!
Just made this for my daughters graduation party and it was a big hit" loved how easy it was" to save time I bought the pineapple already cut up. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

I used the best available fruit-including watermelon. I don't like the texture of bananas in fruit salad so I skipped it. I think any combination of fruit would work. I also only used 1 TBS of sugar in the raw and the juice of one lemon. I didn't want to use that much sugar, but also didn't want it to be too tart. My salad received great reviews. I think adding 1/3 a cup of sugar to a fruit salad would make it taste like a pie filling.
Great recipe! I used all the ingredients, but I did cut the oranges into bite sized chunks. I also cut some of the larger grapes in half.
Crowd Pleaser, And Simple to make :)

Made almost exactly as written, except I only used one orange, not two. I didn't have the time to let it set for more than a couple of hours, but it was still really good. Definitely on the sweeter side, so if you prefer your fruit more in their natural state, you could probably half the amount of sugar and it would still be good. I ended up with quite a bit of liquid at the bottom of the bowl since the fruit created extra juices on top of the syrup you pour over it. Got lots of compliments from my family on this one. Thanks for sharing!
I've made this twice. It took me less time the second bowl. This is so yummy and loved by everyone that I wouldn't care if it took hours to prepare.
We loved this! Perfect for an almost summer day in Florida! Didn't change anything.
I used brown sugar substitute and added pieces of cactus pear,mango,and topped the salad with star fruit. Also, I waited until serving before adding the bananas. Yummy!
I would leave out the bananas but overall this is a great recipe.
did not use kiwi - it was delicious
The syrup for the fruit was delicious. I will definitely make again!
Good mix of fruit. I also skipped the dressing portion of the recipe. The fruit is really good on its own.

I made this for a family Mother's day brunch. I have to confess that I doubled the sugar as the fruit I had was not very sweet. The sauce never thickened but the salad was delicious and no left overs. Next time I will add some gelatin or cornstarch to the sauce.
I made this to take to a carry in.Got lot of compliments.
Every one absolutely loved it I also added black berries.
This was DELICIOUS! Made it according to the directions. It was a hit!
I made this the other day and had some leftover so stuck it in the freezer. Pulled it out today and put some in the blender. Not only is it a delicious salad, it's a great smoothie recipe!
I like the recipe but what is the yield
Made it as written. Turned out great!
Yum and easy
Added mango and changed blue berries for blackberries.... Excellent, Delicious... Wonderful summer salad
The lemon juice is a little much, but I love it other then that!
This salad looked beautiful in a glass bowl with all the different layers and colour, it was enjoyed by all.
OJ, lemon juice and zest worked well, but brown sugar made it way too sweet. Vanilla was a good addition, but I'd cut back to 1/2 tsp.
Tastes great, but it ends up with the fruit floating in an awful lot of juice!
Amazing! First time I have ever made a fruit salad and I love, loved it.. thank you for sharing.
Made it just as the recipe stated - awesome!
